Function Documentation

char* swims_ossdkgetatifname ( void   ) 

Get the Sierra AT command port tty name for library usage.

Returns:
pointer to the AT command port tty name
Abort:
none
Note:
return value can be NULL

The returned string from this function must be handled immediately because the internal storage for it will be overwritten if this function's sibling function - swims_ossdkgetgpsifname() - is called

Can be called regardless of the type of modem connected

char* swims_ossdkgetdmifname ( void   ) 

Get the Sierra Diag command port tty name for library usage.

Returns:
pointer to the Diag command port tty name
Abort:
none
Note:
return value can be NULL

The returned string from this function must be handled immediately because the internal storage for it will be overwritten if this function's sibling function - swims_ossdkgetatifname() and swims_ossdkgetgpsifname() - are called

Can be called regardless of the type of modem connected

char* swims_ossdkgetgpsifname ( void   ) 

Get the Sierra GPS command port tty name for library usage.

Returns:
pointer to the GPS command port tty name
Abort:
none
Note:
return value can be NULL

The returned string from this function must be handled immediately because the internal storage for it will be overwritten if this function's sibling function - swims_ossdkgetatifname() - is called

Can be called regardless of the type of modem connected

char* swims_ossdkgetifname ( swi_uint32  interface  ) 

Get the specified command port tty name for library usage.

Parameters:
interface The modem-agnostic interface type which is translated into a modem-specific type inside this function
Returns:
pointer to the requested command port tty name or NULL if the interface doesn't exist or there was a problem
Abort:
when the PID of modem is invalid
Note:
return value can be NULL
